Legal_Issue: Whether the immigration officer made an unreasonable error in denying the exemption request under humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Evidence_Type: Ties to Canada, son's U.S. citizenship, potential risks in India
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Failure to demonstrate unusual, undeserved, or disproportionate hardship
Evidence_Ignored: Factors such as son's U.S. citizenship, ties to Canada, and risks in India were not adequately addressed or raised before the decision-maker
Application_Factor: Exemption from applying for permanent resident visa outside Canada
Decision_Review_Issue: Unreasonable error in denial of exemption
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA subsection 25(1) – Minister may exempt on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient evidence of humanitarian and compassionate hardship
Evidentiary_Issues: Relevant factors not presented or inadequately supported before the officer
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of officer’s decision
Omission_Type: Failure to raise or substantiate key humanitarian factors
